content:
• Monday, July 25, 2011
  • HLX

    Helix Energy Solutions (NYSE:HLX): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $338.3M (+13%...

    Helix Energy Solutions (NYSE:HLX): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $338.3M (+13% Y/Y). Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWRA, SPWRB) is down 5.9% AH after announcing it expects Q2 revenue of $590M to $600M...

    SunPower (SPWRA, SPWRB) is down 5.9% AH after announcing it expects Q2 revenue of $590M to $600M (ahead of a $572M consensus), and Q2 non-GAAP EPS of -$0.19 to $-0.20 (well below a $0.03 consensus). The weak EPS forecast is the result of a lower-than-expected gross margin, attributed to a shift in product mix. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • QGEN

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN): Q2 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $282M (+7% Y/Y). Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN): Q2 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $282M (+7% Y/Y). Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • STM

    More on STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q2 revenues were in-line with estimates, but EPS fell...

    More on STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q2 revenues were in-line with estimates, but EPS fell far-wide of the mark. The company lowers its Q3 net revenue outlook, primarily due to reduction in demand from a major customer. The quarter will now range from a 5% loss to a 2% gain versus Q2. Shares -5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • BIDU

    More on Baidu's (NASDAQ:BIDU) Q2: Q3 revenue expected to be $611.1M-$626.6M, ahead of $567.9M...

    More on Baidu's (NASDAQ:BIDU) Q2: Q3 revenue expected to be $611.1M-$626.6M, ahead of $567.9M consensus. Company claims 298K active advertising customers in Q2, up 17.3% Y/Y. Revenue per customer of $1,779, +53.3% Y/Y. Traffic acquisition costs decline to 7.9% of revenue from 9.7% in Q2 2010. BIDU +5.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q2 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.6B (+1.4% Y/Y)....

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM): Q2 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.6B (+1.4% Y/Y). Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • TXN

    More on Texas Instruments' (NYSE:TXN) Q2: Revenue slightly above $3.44B consensus. Analog...

    More on Texas Instruments' (NYSE:TXN) Q2: Revenue slightly above $3.44B consensus. Analog revenue +5% Y/Y, wireless -23%. Expects Q3 revenue of $3.4B-$3.7B, midpoint below $3.62B consensus. Expects Q3 EPS of $0.55-$0.65, midpoint below $0.64 consensus. "Lukewarm" production seen among some computing and consumer customers. TXN now +1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • AVGO

    More on Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 revenues in-line, but EPS posted a solid gain on improved gross...

    More on Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 revenues in-line, but EPS posted a solid gain on improved gross margins and record cash flow from operations. The company sees Q3 revenue in-line with current projections, with only a slight reduction in expenses over the quarter. Shares +9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • NFLX

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q2: U.S. subscribers expected to rise only slightly in Q3, to...

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q2: U.S. subscribers expected to rise only slightly in Q3, to 25M. 10M streaming-only, 3M DVD-only, and 12M both streaming and DVDs. Q3 revenue expected to be $780M-$805M, below $847M consensus. 16.3% operating margin in Q2, but company maintaining 14% target for 2011, due to higher streaming-related expenses. NFLX -8.7% AH. (PDF)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM): EPS $0.72 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.8B (+12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.3% AH....

    Broadcom (BRCM): EPS $0.72 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.8B (+12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $788.6M (+52% Y/Y) misses by...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $788.6M (+52% Y/Y) misses by $2.9M. 25.6M total subscribers (24.6M in U.S.) in line with guidance for 24.9M-25.8M. Guides for Q3 EPS of $0.72-$1.07, below $1.09 consensus. Shares -7.7% AH. (PDF)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 5 Comments
  • BAC

    Even if a U.S. debt downgrade might not be the end of the world - if Japan's track record is any...

    Even if a U.S. debt downgrade might not be the end of the world - if Japan's track record is any guide - certain sectors could suffer. Big banks (XLF -0.6%), whose credit ratings get a boost from the implied support of the U.S. government, could feel pain with a downgrade of their sugar daddy. Big banks are also massive holders of Treasury debt. BAC -1.2%, JPM -1%, C -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • BP

    BP (BP +1.7%) gets a follow-on boost after winning two deepwater gas exploration and production...

    BP (BP +1.7%) gets a follow-on boost after winning two deepwater gas exploration and production contracts from the government of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago. Earlier today, JPMorgan had suggested the oil conglomerate could potentially unlock $100B by breaking itself up in similar fashion to ConocoPhillips (COP -0.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • ETFC

    While Citadel continues pressing E-Trade (ETFC +5.1%) to sell, Credit Agricole believes the...

    While Citadel continues pressing E-Trade (ETFC +5.1%) to sell, Credit Agricole believes the company's massive mortgage loan portfolio could be a deterrent. Sandler O'Neill's Richard Repetto assigns the firm a fair value of $18-$21 in an acquisition - a premium from current levels, but still less than 1/10 of E-Trade's share value prior to its late-2007 crash.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • KR

    Kroger (KR -1.4%) and Safeway (SWY -0.9%) both trade lower after Goldman cut them to sell...

    Kroger (KR -1.4%) and Safeway (SWY -0.9%) both trade lower after Goldman cut them to sell earlier today. The firm points out that Safeway's recent Q2 results reveal industry concerns are materializing earlier than anticipated. Lower same-store sales growth hurt margins, Goldman said, and pressures are set to intensify.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) halts sales of Nintendo's (OTCPK:NTDOY -1.8%) 3DS handheld game device...

    Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) halts sales of Nintendo's (OTCPK:NTDOY -1.8%) 3DS handheld game device due to a potential flaw: "There may be something wrong with our inventory of the item, the way we are shipping it, or the way it’s described here." Could be construction flaws, though one analyst thinks it's the device's streaming services like Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) that Amazon has trouble with.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • WNS

    WNS Holdings (WNS +1%) trades higher after Goldman ups the stock to neutral, noting that...

    WNS Holdings (WNS +1%) trades higher after Goldman ups the stock to neutral, noting that improving business conditions should continue to boost the company's margins and improve operating cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • BB

    With RIM (RIMM) down 4% following its layoff announcement, the market doesn't appear satisfied...

    With RIM (RIMM) down 4% following its layoff announcement, the market doesn't appear satisfied with the scope of the company's restructuring. Many still think RIM badly needs to rid itself of its dual-CEO structure. Gartner's Ken Dulaney also thinks the company is starting to take its relatively strong international business for granted.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • BC

    Brunswick (BC +7%) pops after Wells Fargo notes the company should report higher than expected...

    Brunswick (BC +7%) pops after Wells Fargo notes the company should report higher than expected Q2 EPS, and B Riley initiates the shares with a buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • HNSN

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +3.7%) trades higher after the E.U. approves its Magellan Robotic System,...

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +3.7%) trades higher after the E.U. approves its Magellan Robotic System, affixing it with a "Conformite Europeenne" mark and enabling the company to start a full commercial launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • ETN

    More on Eaton Corp (ETN +3.3%): stock trades higher after posting a solid Q2, beating estimates...

    More on Eaton Corp (ETN +3.3%): stock trades higher after posting a solid Q2, beating estimates and lifting its FY outlook. Margin gains were aided by increased production volumes in construction and farm machinery, plus a boost in sales from its struggling commercial-truck business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon's (ONTY -12%) after Martin Shkreli questions the benefits of the company's lung...

    Oncothyreon's (ONTY -12%) after Martin Shkreli questions the benefits of the company's lung cancer drug Stimuvax. He asserts the drug is poorly designed, fails to improve lung cancer survival and is not likely to pass its phase III testing trials. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 5 Comments

  • Delta Petroleum (DPTRD) is up 13.5% after announcing strong initial results for its 2C gas well,...

    Delta Petroleum (DPTRD) is up 13.5% after announcing strong initial results for its 2C gas well, which began production on Wednesday. The company will be releasing Q2 results on 8/4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is down 2.6% after UBS' Uche Orji cut his PT to $16.50 from $20, while...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is down 2.6% after UBS' Uche Orji cut his PT to $16.50 from $20, while reiterating a Hold. Orji believes AMD's Q2 graphics weakness doesn't bode well for Nvidia's results (due next month), and also sees strong competition for the company's Tegra smartphone and tablet processors from Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) and Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT -5%) sinks after Cantor downgrades it to sell on valuation, citing a...

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT -5%) sinks after Cantor downgrades it to sell on valuation, citing a weak spot market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOLI

    Hollysys Automation Technologies (HOLI -21%) tanks following Saturday's fatal collision between...

    Hollysys Automation Technologies (HOLI -21%) tanks following Saturday's fatal collision between two high-speed trains in China. The company - a leading provider of high-speed rail signaling controls in China - has since confirmed its systems were functioning properly at the time of the crash. Roth downgrades the shares to neutral on concerns over the industry's future.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • LO

    More on Lorillard (LO -4.6%): despite an 11% rise in earnings, Q2 revenue missed expectations as...

    More on Lorillard (LO -4.6%): despite an 11% rise in earnings, Q2 revenue missed expectations as margins were hit by higher-than-expected advertising costs, and volume gains came mostly from its cheaper brands.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • NBGGY

    Moody's places 8 Greek banks on review for possible downgrade in the wake of its conviction of...

    Moody's places 8 Greek banks on review for possible downgrade in the wake of its conviction of the near certainty the country's paper will soon be placed in default. National Bank of Greece NBG -4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • CNH

    More on CNH Global (CNH +9.1%): shares jump after blowing out Q2 estimates across-the-board, as...

    More on CNH Global (CNH +9.1%): shares jump after blowing out Q2 estimates across-the-board, as rising agricultural prices fueled steady demand in sales of agricultural and construction equipment. The company says demand from both sectors will continue to post double-digit gains through the end of 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • HCA

    Hospital shares are weak in early trading, after HCA's (HCA -14%) disappointing Q2 results serve...

    Hospital shares are weak in early trading, after HCA's (HCA -14%) disappointing Q2 results serve as a "harbinger of bad things to come" for the sector this quarter, a Jefferies note says. Hospitals continue to struggle, as Americans who lost their jobs and health insurance avoid all but the most urgent medical care. Also: CYH -4.3%, THC -4%, HMA -3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP -22%) stumbles hard out of the gate, despite announcing that its...

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP -22%) stumbles hard out of the gate, despite announcing that its Phase 3 clinical trial of DR Cysteamine has met the primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +8%) continues to trade higher today after JPMorgan initiates it...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +8%) continues to trade higher today after JPMorgan initiates it with an overweight. The stock has been on a tear recently, gaining over 100% since April when BofA Merrill Lynch first upgraded it to buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • IMAX

    IMAX is down 4.3% as Stifel Nicholas lowers its PT to $27 from $32. Stifel, which is maintaining...

    IMAX is down 4.3% as Stifel Nicholas lowers its PT to $27 from $32. Stifel, which is maintaining its Hold rating, doesn't expect three 3-D children's movies arriving in Q4 to perform well, and believes consensus estimates for the second half are too optimistic.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • ROP

    Roper Industries (ROP +2.5%) posts a strong Q2 as profits rose 49% on double-digit sales growth...

    Roper Industries (ROP +2.5%) posts a strong Q2 as profits rose 49% on double-digit sales growth across all units. The company raises its FY earnings outlook again.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ETFC

    In response to E-Trade's (NASDAQ:ETFC) rejection of its request for a special shareholder...

    In response to E-Trade's (NASDAQ:ETFC) rejection of its request for a special shareholder meeting, Citadel is upping the pressure. The hedge fund is now demanding the online broker call a meeting in no less than 60 days. Shares +6.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • HCA

    HCA (NYSE:HCA) continues to fall premarket after missing earnings expectations. CEO Richard...

    HCA (NYSE:HCA) continues to fall premarket after missing earnings expectations. CEO Richard Bracken says the company "experienced a shift in service mix from more complex surgical cases to less acute medical cases," resulting in lower revenue and earnings growth. Shares -14.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • SLAB

    Silicon Laboratories (NASDAQ:SLAB) Q2 EPS $0.48 beats by $0.02. Sales of $126M misses by $1M....

    Silicon Laboratories (NASDAQ:SLAB) Q2 EPS $0.48 beats by $0.02. Sales of $126M misses by $1M. Profits fell 36% as the semiconductor maker posted narrower margins and lower sales on weakening end-user demand. Shares -7.9% premarket. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • PEP

    Confirming earlier chatter, Goldman removes Pepsi (PEP -1%) from its Conviction Buy list and...

    Confirming earlier chatter, Goldman removes Pepsi (PEP -1%) from its Conviction Buy list and cuts the stock to Neutral. The stock has lagged the S&P and Goldman is lowering its EPS estimate to reflect "a lower profit outlook in Pepsi Americas Beverages on weaker price realization."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • KMB

    More on Kimberly-Clark (NYSE:KMB): Q2 profits dipped 18% as the company struggles to offset...

    More on Kimberly-Clark (NYSE:KMB): Q2 profits dipped 18% as the company struggles to offset rising commodity costs with price increases that won't erode its competitiveness. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:RPTP) meets its primary endpoint in its Phase 3 clinical trial of...

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:RPTP) meets its primary endpoint in its Phase 3 clinical trial of delayed release Cysteamine for the treatment of nephropathic cystinosis. Shares, which had climbed as high as 5.5% earlier in the morning, are now +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • QGEN

    Wedbush downgrades Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN) to neutral, citing the worsening EU situation and...

    Wedbush downgrades Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN) to neutral, citing the worsening EU situation and increased risks from Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) HPV competition. Shares -1.68% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • HCA

    HCA (NYSE:HCA): Q2 EPS of $0.55 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $8.01B (+4% Y/Y). Shares -9.3%...

    HCA (NYSE:HCA): Q2 EPS of $0.55 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $8.01B (+4% Y/Y). Shares -9.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +1.85%) is scheduled to report earnings after the close, with analysts likely to...

    Netflix (NFLX +1.85%) is scheduled to report earnings after the close, with analysts likely to focus not just on the headline numbers but also on subscriber growth, costs and margins amid concerns that content distribution deals, including rumored talks with DreamWorks, will grow increasingly costly for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SO

    Goldman downgrades Southern Co. (NYSE:SO) to Sell from Neutral, sending shares down 2.05%. More...

    Goldman downgrades Southern Co. (NYSE:SO) to Sell from Neutral, sending shares down 2.05%. More details to follow.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 3 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) is up 2.9% premarket, as four different firms - Citi, William Blair, Wells...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) is up 2.9% premarket, as four different firms - Citi, William Blair, Wells Fargo, and JPMorgan - initiate coverage with positive ratings. Stifel Nicholas is also initiating with a Hold. The company lost 3.9% on Friday, following reports that Spotify had already signed up 70K premium subscribers.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 3 Comments
  • BIG

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) announces the signing of a new $700M five-year unsecured revolving credit...

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) announces the signing of a new $700M five-year unsecured revolving credit facility, to replace a $500M facility which was set to expire in April 2012. BIG -0.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • AMTD

    TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) will reportedly discuss buying E-Trade Financial (ETFC +5.1%) at a...

    TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) will reportedly discuss buying E-Trade Financial (ETFC +5.1%) at a board meeting tomorrow after a major E-Trade shareholder last week said the company should consider selling itself.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • IRE

    Bank of Ireland (IRE +7.8%) is sharply higher premarket as it sells a €1.1B stake to a...

    Bank of Ireland (IRE +7.8%) is sharply higher premarket as it sells a €1.1B stake to a group of private investors that will keep the lender from falling into government ownership. No word on the buyers, but TPG Capital, J.C. Flowers, and China are being tossed about.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • PEP

    Pepsi (NYSE:PEP) shares are off 1% premarket on word Goldman Sachs has removed the company from...

    Pepsi (NYSE:PEP) shares are off 1% premarket on word Goldman Sachs has removed the company from its Conviction Buy list.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) shares -2.8% premarket after the announcement of 2K job cuts and...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) shares -2.8% premarket after the announcement of 2K job cuts and that COO Don Morrison - currently on medical leave - is retiring.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • GLF

    U.S. stock index futures, modestly lower on worries about the debt limit debate, belie bigger...

    U.S. stock index futures, modestly lower on worries about the debt limit debate, belie bigger action elsewhere. The greenback plummets nearly 2% to another record low vs. the Swiss franc. Gold sits at a new record of $1,618/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 AM | 1 Comment
